alert.note: Alert for Butler (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 12:50PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Butler and Ripley. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Heavy rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. Locally higher totals are possible. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poplar Bluff, Doniphan, Naylor, Neelyville, Qulin, Fisk, Fairdealing, Milltown, Oxly, Budapest, Harviell, Brush Arbor, Hendrickson, Gatewood, Handy, Briar and Rombauer.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
